intro: Pasania pierrei, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial shrub, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its flowers, which come in shades of purple, violet, and white, bloom throughout the year under proper care. Pasania pierrei is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
